title: Georgia Senate Runoff Election Results
html_content:
LIVE

Last updated 11:48 p.m. E.T.

Kelly Loeffler Loeffler Republican incumbent Rep. incumbent

Raphael Warnock Warnock Democrat Dem.

David Perdue Perdue Republican incumbent Rep. incumbent

Jon Ossoff Ossoff Democrat Dem.

U.S. Senate Special Election: Loeffler vs. Warnock

Senator Kelly Loeffler, who was appointed to her seat in 2019 and is seeking to finish a term that ends in 2022, is vying against the Rev. Raphael Warnock, who leads Ebenezer Baptist Church in Atlanta. In November’s crowded special election, Mr. Warnock finished with 32.9 percent of the vote and Ms. Loeffler had 25.9 percent.

Updated 2m ago

95% reported

Candidate Party Votes Pct.
Warnock Raphael Warnock Democrat Dem. 2,191,005 50.37%
Loeffler* Kelly Loeffler* Republican Rep. 2,158,633 49.63%
Total reported Total reported 4,349,638

* Incumbent

Live forecast

Expected Margin

 

Warnock +1.9

Warnock +3 to Warnock +1.1

Win Prob.

 

Very likely Warnock

>95% Warnock

Note: Absentee vote data may not be available in some places. November margin shows the difference between the total vote shares for Democrats and for Republicans in the general election.

U.S. Senate: Perdue vs. Ossoff

David Perdue, a Republican whose Senate term ended on Sunday, has faced a competitive challenge from Jon Ossoff, a documentary film executive. In November, Mr. Perdue fell just short of the majority he would have needed to avoid a runoff, winning 49.7 percent of the vote, while Mr. Ossoff had 47.9 percent — a difference of about 88,000 votes.

Updated 2m ago

95% reported

Candidate Party Votes Pct.
Perdue* David Perdue* Republican Rep. 2,176,617 50.04%
Ossoff Jon Ossoff Democrat Dem. 2,172,905 49.96%
Total reported Total reported 4,349,522

* Incumbent

Live forecast

Expected Margin

 

Ossoff +1.1

Ossoff +1.9 to Ossoff <0.5

Win Prob.

 

Pretty likely Ossoff

>95% Ossoff

Note: Absentee vote data may not be available in some places. November margin shows the difference between the total vote shares for Perdue and Ossoff in the general election.

Stephanie Saul 4m ago

Gov. Brian Kemp appointed Kelly Loeffler to the Senate in 2019, surmising that she would appeal to moderates. But she moved to the right, becoming a major Trump supporter.
